Take breaks in between sessions and utilize the coffee break areas provided to strike up conversations with new people
Start by joining some smaller group discussions or workshops and meeting people there
Attend events with his labmates and try to meet new people through them, expanding his network step by step
label: Start by joining some smaller group discussions or workshops and meeting people there

scenario: Daniel was offered a prestigious position with a company located in another country. He decided the opportunity was worth moving to.
subject: Daniel
choices: Regret applying for this job when he didn't want to leave
Plan systematic contact methods, such as regular phone calls or emails every week
Spend more time on work related to the new position to prepare for his new position
Help his wife find a job in the other country, convince her to quit her job and move with him
label: Plan systematic contact methods, such as regular phone calls or emails every week

scenario: Joel has always dealt with one particular client but on a very complex job his boss gives the task to a co-worker instead. Joel wonders whether his boss thinks he can't handle the important jobs.
subject: Joel
choices: Talk to his boss and express his concern about others being assigned the task
Do good work so that he will be given the complex tasks in future
Ask his boss to give the job to him
Not worry about this unless it happens again
label: Do good work so that he will be given the complex tasks in future
